content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: Dennis boldly contravened the school’s directive about leaving the grounds during the day.
The default delivery method is surface mail; please check the “air mail” box if you wish for a faster delivery.
Banners emblazoned with team colors were hung all around the stadium.
Steven was nervous about his performance because he was just a novice at lacrosse.
Despite her age, Aunt Myrtle was spry on the dance floor.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: To his chagrin, Dante tripped while trying to sneak up on Beatrice.
Marc’s doldrums continued for weeks after moving to a new city.
A Pulitzer Prize is proof of a writer’s eminence.
Richard expended so much energy preparing for the game that he was too tired to enjoy it.
The coat was held together by a few tenuous threads.

content.question: A belated action is performed
How might someone default on a loan?
options: by paying the loan on time
by paying off a loan completely

content.question: When a password expires, it
Which of the following is the most tenuous?
How well known is a truism likely to be?

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: To her chagrin, Pilar learned that the eminent biologist she’d idolized since she was a child wasn’t going to come speak at her school after all. Pilar and her classmates in Honors Biology had been looking forward to the visit for six months, when it was suddenly canceled. It wasn’t often that an award-winning scientist of such high caliber made it all the way out to the rural area where she lived. In fact, Pilar had never met a working biologist at all and really wanted to ask her some questions.

Pilar’s biology teacher, Ms. Assad, had arranged the visit through a tenuous connection—Ms. Assad’s second cousin had worked in the same research laboratory. Pilar was disappointed but didn’t lose hope. Her teacher was a big exponent of connecting young women to leaders in the science, math, and technology fields. She knew Ms. Assad would find another biologist willing to trek out to the middle of nowhere to talk to her class. It was just a matter of time.

content.question: The phrase “to her chagrin” (line 1) most nearly means
In line 1, eminent means
The word caliber (line 6) most nearly means
In line 11, tenuous most nearly means
In line 14, the phrase “exponent of” most nearly means
